item.title: Text Cleaning
item.description: library(tidyverse) First, I need to bring in my data. bad <- read_csv("badfootballlogs19.csv") Then, we need to separate the result into Outcome and Score while getting rid of the first parenthesis in the score. bad %>% separate(Result, into=c("Outcome", "Score"), sep="\\(") %>% head() ## # A tibble: 6 × 52 ## Game Date HomeAway Opponent Outcome Score PassingCmp PassingAtt PassingPct ## <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 1 8/24/19 N Miami (… "W " 24-2… 17 27 63 ## 2 2 9/7/19 <NA> Tenness… "W " 45-0) 30 36 83.

item.title: Nebraska Baseball 2020-2021
item.description: At the beginning of the 2021 baseball season Nebraska was looking to come out firing on all cylinders for Will Bolt’s first full season as the head coach for the Huskers, after the 2020 season was cut short due to COVID-19 striking the nation. The Huskers had previously made it to the Big Ten championship in 2019 only to lose to a talented Ohio State team, and continue on to lose out of the regional at Oklahoma State.
